benchmark_details.name: MedBookVQA
benchmark_details.overview: MedBookVQA is a systematic and comprehensive multimodal benchmark derived from open-access medical textbooks, consisting of 5,000 clinically relevant questions across various medical VQA task categories.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating General Medical Artificial Intelligence (GMAI) systems across diverse medical domains.

data.source: Open-access medical textbooks from DOAB (Directory of Open Access Books).
data.annotation: Automated extraction of medical figures paired with narrative context.

methods: Evaluation on a variety of models
methodology.calculation: Percentage of correctly answered questions across VQA tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in medical VQA tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Measured against various multimodal large language models (MLLMs).
methodology.validation: Tests conducted on diverse MLLMs, revealing significant capability gaps in GMAI systems.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: No sensitive data included as information is sourced from publicly available textbooks.
